snippet.textDisplay:
I had to send my Wii in for repair last year. While it was away, I thought it would be a good time to play Mario Sunshine, since I never finished it back in 2002. I forgot all about this song. It was such a lovely surprise to re-discover it on the Noki Bay level.
It will never be as good as Mario 64 but Sunshine is still a great game
snippet.textOriginal:
I had to send my Wii in for repair last year. While it was away, I thought it would be a good time to play Mario Sunshine, since I never finished it back in 2002. I forgot all about this song. It was such a lovely surprise to re-discover it on the Noki Bay level.
It will never be as good as Mario 64 but Sunshine is still a great game

snippet.textDisplay: @Zachary1869 Ha. I'm 18, don't live around any of my friends at the moment.
snippet.textOriginal: @Zachary1869 Ha. I'm 18, don't live around any of my friends at the moment.

snippet.textDisplay: @Zachary1869 Honestly I don't remember which is which, it's been quite some time since I've played. This discussion convinced me to get another copy, but the one I got from Gamestop didn't work. =.= Not sure where I put the receipt either. Blah.
snippet.textOriginal: @Zachary1869 Honestly I don't remember which is which, it's been quite some time since I've played. This discussion convinced me to get another copy, but the one I got from Gamestop didn't work. =.= Not sure where I put the receipt either. Blah.

snippet.textDisplay: @Zachary1869 Oh, true. Well, I think I played too much Mario Party, so the only challenge on the thumb was getting the stick to work properly.
snippet.textOriginal: @Zachary1869 Oh, true. Well, I think I played too much Mario Party, so the only challenge on the thumb was getting the stick to work properly.

snippet.textDisplay: @Zachary1869 Yeah, I'm not saying it was flawless. That's a good point. Also, the Sunshine boss was obviously silly, but I liked it anyway. The final fight always seems to be a cakewalk. That's just a Mario trademark, I guess. xD
snippet.textOriginal: @Zachary1869 Yeah, I'm not saying it was flawless. That's a good point. Also, the Sunshine boss was obviously silly, but I liked it anyway. The final fight always seems to be a cakewalk. That's just a Mario trademark, I guess. xD

snippet.textDisplay: @Zachary1869 No no, I am capable of keeping a level head in a harmless conversation. I just felt the opposite way; Galaxy left me wanting more because the levels were large and seemed so open with their space them, but there was little to actually do. And goodness, if by some possible chance you got lost, they conveniently placed Toad there to tell you which way was forward. >w>
snippet.textOriginal: @Zachary1869 No no, I am capable of keeping a level head in a harmless conversation. I just felt the opposite way; Galaxy left me wanting more because the levels were large and seemed so open with their space them, but there was little to actually do. And goodness, if by some possible chance you got lost, they conveniently placed Toad there to tell you which way was forward. >w>

snippet.textDisplay: @Zachary1869 Linearity was the basis of Mario in the beginning, yes, but it seems so much more limited when applied to the third dimension.
snippet.textOriginal: @Zachary1869 Linearity was the basis of Mario in the beginning, yes, but it seems so much more limited when applied to the third dimension.

snippet.textDisplay:
It's amusing to see people call this game gimmicky but praise the Wii.

This is a superb game. It fine-tuned the physics of Mario 64, presented an original, entertaining and well-executed idea, featured amazing level design (and music, of course) and had a great world to explore, and that is far more than you can say about Galaxy, which was linearity to the extreme.
snippet.textOriginal:
It's amusing to see people call this game gimmicky but praise the Wii.

This is a superb game. It fine-tuned the physics of Mario 64, presented an original, entertaining and well-executed idea, featured amazing level design (and music, of course) and had a great world to explore, and that is far more than you can say about Galaxy, which was linearity to the extreme.

snippet.textOriginal: @Zachary1869 You act as though the blue coins were required in any way.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Agreed. gets too boring after awhile. it's good for the first couple of levels, but after that it kinda treads on thin waters...it kinda reminds me of Spyro 2 and 3. sure it's fun at the beginning and has good music, but it just gets too boring to be interesting enough to finish...
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Agreed. gets too boring after awhile. it's good for the first couple of levels, but after that it kinda treads on thin waters...it kinda reminds me of Spyro 2 and 3. sure it's fun at the beginning and has good music, but it just gets too boring to be interesting enough to finish...

snippet.textDisplay: In the Mario formula, this game is just as good as the rest. I think what people want to say is that it clearly isn't as groundbreaking as most of the greats in the series are identified for. It's still a good game. It's still fun. I never got to beat it, but I never had a GameCube.
snippet.textOriginal: In the Mario formula, this game is just as good as the rest. I think what people want to say is that it clearly isn't as groundbreaking as most of the greats in the series are identified for. It's still a good game. It's still fun. I never got to beat it, but I never had a GameCube.

snippet.textDisplay:
Just back from NYC, all caught up, continuing to love the choices and I have to agree with your opinion of this, least fav Mario(ok, you said 3d I say in general), but still fun. Speaking of Nintendo, any fans of the company, even if it is small and overpriced, you gotta visit Nintendo World. THEY HAVE KIRBY PILLOWS!
And here's something we can all love...they play the best Nintendo system songs all day long. I'm standing there listenign to Gerudo Valley, Megaman, and actually #741 as I left!
snippet.textOriginal:
